block.l: function factorial ( n ) { return (( n == 0 ? 1 : n * factorial ( n - 1 ) )) }; window.alert ( factorial ( 5 ) )
result = copy(x); result.isContinuation = false return result

switch (+age) { case 1: window.alert("You're one."); break; case 2: window.alert("You're two."); break; case 3: window.alert("You're three."); case 4: window.alert("You're three or four."); break; default: window.alert("You're not 1,2,3 or 4!"); }

switch (age) { case 1: window.alert("You're one."); break; case 2: window.alert("You're two."); break; case 3: window.alert("You're three."); case 4: window.alert("You're three or four."); break; default: window.alert("You're not 1,2,3 or 4!"); }

custom-block.s: block data: spec: %s body: %cmdRing category: %s shape: %s global: %b

block-definition.comment: The input name block. Use it in function ( ) { } statements.

The second input is an "association list," a list of two-item lists. Each of those smaller lists has a "key" as its first item and a "value" as its second. ASSOC reports the first key-value pair in the association list whose key matches the first input.
Takes any number of numbers as inputs (use the left and right arrowheads to adjust the number of input slots) and reports the result of adding them all, so ISUM (4) (100) (8)) reports 112.
Takes any number of numbers as inputs (use the left and right arrowheads to adjust the number of input slots) and reports the result of multiplying them all, so (PRODUCT (4) (100) (8)) reports 3200.

Takes any number of Boolean (true/false) inputs (use the left and right arrowheads to adjust the number of input slots) and reports TRUE only if all of the inputs are TRUE, otherwise FALSE. Like AND but for multiple inputs.
Takes any number of Boolean (true/false) inputs (use the left and right arrowheads to adjust the number of input slots) and reports TRUE if at least one input is TRUE, otherwise FALSE.

block.l: var ide = this.parentThatIsA(IDE_Morph); if (!ide || !('custom_reg' in ide)) throw new Error('Entry of index '+ID+' must be in IDE`s registry!'); if (ID == 'last') { ID = ide.custom_reg.length - 1; } else { if (ID>=ide.custom_reg.length) throw new RangeError('ID is out of range!'); } var entry = ide.custom_reg[ID]; if (!entry.id == ID) throw TypeError('Entry must be valid entry!'); // Block registration var definition = new CustomBlockDefinition(entry.spec); definition.body = copy(entry.body); definition.type = entry.type.toLowerCase(); definition.category = entry.category.toLowerCase(); var isGlobal = entry.isGlobal; var target = isGlobal ? this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph) : this; if (!target) { console.warn('CUSTOM BLOCK REG: can`t find stage!'); target = this; isGlobal = false } definition.receiver = target; definition.isGlobal = isGlobal; var spec = BlockMorph.prototype.parseSpec.call(null, definition.spec); var custom_blocks_buffor = isGlobal ? target.globalBlocks : target.customBlocks; var inputNames = definition.body.inputs; var i = -1; BlockMorph.prototype.parseSpec.call(null, entry.spec).forEach(function(input, idx){ if (!((input[0] == '%') && (input.length > 1))) return; ++i; definition.declarations[inputNames[i]] = [input, '', '', false]; spec[idx] = '%\''+inputNames[i]+'\''; }); definition.spec = spec.join(' '); custom_blocks_buffor.push(definition); ide.flushPaletteCache(); ide.refreshPalette();

block-definition.s: block data: spec: %'spec' body: %'body' category: %'category' shape: %'shape' global: %'isGlobal'

inputs.input: OtherMotion Looks Sounds Pen Control Sensing Operators Data Lists Other

custom-block.l: Command Block`s body must be a Cmd Ring!
Shape must be Cmd Rep or Pred!

block.l: args = args.asArray(); var ide = this.parentThatIsA(IDE_Morph); if (!ide) throw new Error('Cannot find IDE!'); if(!('custom_reg' in ide)) ide.custom_reg = []; ide.custom_reg.push({id: ide.custom_reg.length, spec: args[0], body: copy(args[1]), category: args[2], type: args[3], isGlobal: args[4]}); return ide.custom_reg.length - 1; // ID of entry in register (0..N)
var ide = this.parentThatIsA(IDE_Morph); if (ide && ('custom_reg' in ide)) { ide.custom_reg = []; }

var ide = this.parentThatIsA(IDE_Morph); if (ide && ('custom_reg' in ide)) { return new List(ide.custom_reg.map(function(entry){ return new List([entry.id, entry.spec, copy(entry.body), entry.category, entry.type, entry.isGlobal]); })); } return new List();

inputs.input: with inputswith inputs with input list

block-definition.comment: Take any number of input lists, and create a new list containing the items of the input lists. So APPEND [A B] [C D] where the [,,,] are lists reports the list [A B C D] not [[A B] [C D]].
Reports a new list containing the items of the input list, but in the opposite order.
Reports a new list whose items are the same as in the input list, except that if two or more equal items appear in the input list, only the last one is kept in the result.

Reports a sorted version of the list in its first input slot, using the comparison function in the second input slot. For a list of numbers, using < as the comparison function will sort from low to high; using > will sort from high to low.
Call f(f(f(...(f(x))))) n times where the three input slots are n, f, and x from left to right. The # variable can be used inside f to represent how many times f has been called.

Call f(f(f(...(f(x))))) until condition is true, where the three input slots are condition, f, and x from left to right. The # variable can be used inside f or condition to indicate how many times f has been called.
Returns the function f(g(x)) where f and g are the two inputs.
Like the built-in REPEAT UNTIL block, except that the ending condition is not tested until the script has been run the first time. So the script is run at least once.
Run the script repeatedly, as long as the given condition is true. Runs the script at least once before testing the condition.

Runs the script repeatedly, as long as the condition is true. Tests the condition before the first time the script is run. Like the built in REPEAT UNTIL except that in this block the condition must be true, not false.

Runs the script the specified number of times, like the built-in REPEAT block, but this one provides the # variable that can be used inside the script. Try REPEAT (200) MOVE (#) STEPS RIGHT 92 with the pen down.
Provides LOOP as a function of one input that runs the body of the LET with A set to the function input, so the body can run itself recursively. See COPY block in Variables for an example of use.
copy VALUE N times reports a list containing N (identical) copies of VALUE
LABEL will stamp text on the stage at the given font size. The direction of the text is the direction the sprite is facing, and color will match the pen color.

block.l: var stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph), context = stage.penTrails().getContext('2d'), rotation = radians(this.direction() - 90), trans = new Point( this.center().x - stage.left(), this.center().y - stage.top() ), isWarped = this.Warped, len, pos; if (isWarped) {endWarp(); } context.save(); context.font = size + 'px monospace'; context.textAlign = 'left'; context.textBaseline = 'alphabetic'; context.fillStyle = this.color.toString(); len = context.measureText(text).width; trans = trans.multiplyBy(1 / stage.scale); context.translate(trans.x, trans.y); context.rotate(rotation); context.fillText(text, 0, 0); context.translate(-trans.x, -trans.y); context.restore(); pos = new Point( len * Math.sin(radians(this.direction())), len * Math.cos(radians(this.direction()))); pos = pos.add(new Point(this.xPosition(), this.yPosition())); this.gotoXY(pos.x, pos.y, false); this.changed(); if (isWarped) {this.startWarp(); } stage.changed();
var oldHandleError = proc.handleError, oldCatchingErrors = proc.isCatchingErrors; return function(){ proc.handleError = oldHandleError; proc.isCatchingErrors = oldCatchingErrors; }

proc.isCatchingErrors = true; proc.handleError = function(error, element){ reset(); proc.context = handler; proc.context.variables.setVar("error", error); } try{ proc.evaluate(action, new List(), true); } catch(e){ proc.handleError(e, null); }

block-definition.s: %'list' in front of %'item' to the right
make all combinations of items of %'lists' combining with %'combiner' building up from %'so far' and do %'action' for each combination

custom-block.s: make all combinations of items of %mult%l combining with %repRing building up from %s and do %cs for each combination

block.l: var cst = new Costume( this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph).trailsCanvas ); cst.shrinkWrap(); return cst;
var stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph); stage.trailsCanvas = cst.contents; stage.changed();

block-definition.comment: Convert a script into a function callable from inside a JavaScript function as a callback.

block.l: var call = false; var args = []; var setCall = function(v) { call = v === undefined ? true : !!v; }; var getCall = function() { return call; }; var getArgs = function() { return args; }; var setArgs = function(a) { args = new List(a); }; var resolve = function() { setArgs(arguments); call = true; }; return {setCall: setCall, getCall: getCall, getArgs: getArgs, resolve: resolve};
